# Large Steering Document for Performance Testing

## Purpose

This is a very large steering document (>1MB) used for performance testing. It contains extensive content to test how the extension handles large files.

The purpose of this document is to provide a realistic test case for performance validation. Large documents can reveal performance bottlenecks in parsing, rendering, and validation logic.

### Subsection 1.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics0 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor0 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics0[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics0): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 3.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics2 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor2 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics2[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics2): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 5.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics4 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor4 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics4[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics4): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 7.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics6 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor6 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics6[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics6): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 9.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics8 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor8 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics8[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics8): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 11.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics10 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor10 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics10[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics10): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 13.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics12 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor12 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics12[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics12): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 15.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics14 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor14 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics14[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics14): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 17.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics16 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor16 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics16[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics16): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 19.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics18 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor18 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics18[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics18): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 24.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics23 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor23 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics23[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics23): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 26.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics25 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor25 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics25[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics25): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 28.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics27 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor27 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics27[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics27): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 30.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics29 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor29 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics29[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics29): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 32.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics31 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor31 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics31[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics31): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 34.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics33 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor33 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics33[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics33): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 36.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics35 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor35 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics35[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics35): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 38.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics37 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor37 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics37[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics37): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics39 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor39 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics39[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics39): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics41 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor41 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics41[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics41): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

2. **Concept B**: Implementing efficient algorithms and data structures
3. **Concept C**: Monitoring and measuring performance metrics
4. **Concept D**: Identifying and resolving performance bottlenecks

### Subsection 44.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics43 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor43 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics43[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics43): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 47.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics46 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor46 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics46[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics46): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 49.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics48 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor48 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics48[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics48): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 51.2: Key Concepts

### Subsection 51.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics50 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor50 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics50[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics50): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 53.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics52 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor52 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics52[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics52): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 55.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics54 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor54 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics54[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics54): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 57.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics56 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor56 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics56[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics56): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 59.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics58 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor58 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics58[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics58): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 61.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics60 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor60 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics60[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics60): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics62 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor62 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics62[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics62): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics64 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor64 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics64[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics64): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 70.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics69 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor69 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics69[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics69): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 72.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics71 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor71 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics71[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics71): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 74.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics73 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor73 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics73[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics73): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 76.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics75 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor75 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics75[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics75): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 78.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics77 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor77 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics77[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics77): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 80.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics79 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor79 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics79[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics79): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 82.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics81 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor81 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics81[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics81): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 84.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics83 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor83 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics83[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics83): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 86.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics85 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor85 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics85[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics85): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics87 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor87 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics87[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics87): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics89 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor89 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics89[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics89): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 93.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics92 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor92 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics92[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics92): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 95.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics94 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor94 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics94[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics94): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 97.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics96 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor96 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics96[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics96): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```

### Subsection 99.3: Implementation Guidelines

```typescript
interface PerformanceMetrics98 {
  responseTime: number;
  throughput: number;
  errorRate: number;
  cpuUsage: number;
  memoryUsage: number;
}

class PerformanceMonitor98 {
  private metrics: PerformanceMetrics98[] = [];
  
  recordMetric(metric: PerformanceMetrics98): void {
    this.metrics.push(metric);
    if (this.metrics.length > 1000) {
      this.metrics.shift();
    }
  }
  
  getAverageResponseTime(): number {
    return this.metrics.reduce((sum, m) => sum + m.responseTime, 0) / this.metrics.length;
  }
}
```
